first_reading.text:
[[Ac 12,24]]The word of God continued to spread and grow.
[[Ac 12,25]]After Barnabas and Saul completed their relief mission, they returned to Jerusalem, taking with them John, who is called Mark.
[[Ac 13,1]]Now there were in the church at Antioch prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Symeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen who was a close friend of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
[[Ac 13,2]]While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting, the holy Spirit said, "Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them."
[[Ac 13,3]]Then, completing their fasting and prayer, they laid hands on them and sent them off.
[[Ac 13,4]]So they, sent forth by the holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia and from there sailed to Cyprus.
[[Ac 13,5a]]When they arrived in Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues. They had John also as their assistant.
first_reading.title: Acts of the Apostles

psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Jn 12,44]]Jesus cried out and said,  "Whoever believes in me believes not only in me  but also in the one who sent me,
[[Jn 12,45]]and whoever sees me sees the one who sent me.
[[Jn 12,46]]I came into the world as light, so that everyone who believes in me might not remain in darkness.
[[Jn 12,47]]And if anyone hears my words and does not observe them, I do not condemn him, for I did not come to condemn the world but to save the world.
[[Jn 12,48]]Whoever rejects me and does not accept my words has something to judge him: the word that I spoke, it will condemn him on the last day,
[[Jn 12,49]]because I did not speak on my own, but the Father who sent me commanded me what to say and speak.
[[Jn 12,50]]And I know that his commandment is eternal life. So what I say, I say as the Father told me."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
